weapons.name: Burning Portent
weapons.description: Hand Weapon enchantment. Attacks made with this weapon have their Armour Penetration set to 10 and gain Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks, and Multiple Wounds (D3).

weapons.name: Symbol of Slaughter
weapons.description: Hand Weapon and Paired Weapons enchantment. When using this weapon, the wielder gains +2 Attack Value, +2 Agility, and suffers -2 Offensive Skill. Attacks made with this weapon gain Magical Attacks.

armours.name: Thrice-Forged
armours.description: Standard Size models only. Suit of Armour enchantment. The wearer gains +3 Armour.

armours.name: Gladiator’s Spirit
armours.description: Suit of Armour enchantment. The wearer gains +1 Armour and Parry.

standards.name: Icon of the Infinite
standards.description: 0-2 per Army. Cannot be taken by units that count towards Core. The bearer can cast Hellfire (Hereditary Spell) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8).

standards.name: Zealots’ Banner
standards.description: 0-3 per Army. The maximum number of Supporting Attacks that models in the second rank of the bearer’s unit can perform is increased by 1.

standards.name: Wasteland Torch
standards.description: The bearer’s unit gains Strider (Ruins). After determining Deployment Zones (at the end of step 6 of the Pre-Game Sequence), you may choose a single Field, or Forest Terrain Feature that becomes Ruins

artefacts.name: Ledger of Souls
artefacts.description: Dominant. Whenever a friendly model with Hell-Forged Armour or Irredeemable within 12″ of the bearer, or a model in the bearer’s unit is removed as a casualty, you gain one Veil Token for each Health Point the model (that was removed as a casualty) started the game with. In addition, at the end of Siphon the Veil, the army may keep up to 6 Veil Tokens (instead of the normal 3).

artefacts.name: Immortal Gauntlets
artefacts.description: At the start of any Round of Combat you may discard a Veil Token from your Veil Token pool. If so, choose either Divine Attacks, Flaming Attacks, or Magical Attacks. The bearer’s Close Combat Attacks gain the chosen Attack Attribute. The chosen effect lasts until the end of the phase.

artefacts.name: Orb of Foreboding
artefacts.description: At the start of the Deployment Phase, immediately before step 1 (Determine who deploys first), you may choose one of the opponent’s non-Character units. This unit loses Vanguard and Scout. The opponent must immediately deploy this unit. This is done outside the normal Deployment procedure and is ignored when determining the first deployed unit and the number of deployed units.

artefacts.name: Lord of the Damned
artefacts.description: Sorcerers and Doomlords only. Any unit with Irredeemable within 18″ of the bearer may reroll the distance it moves in the Movement Phase with Random Movement.

artefacts.name: Wyrd Stone
artefacts.description: One use only. Must be activated when the bearer’s model is hit by an attack with at least Strength 5 or at least Armour Penetration 5. The bearer’s model gains Aegis (4+). If the bearer’s model is Standard or Large, this effect is lost at end of the Player Turn. If the bearer’s model is Gigantic, this effect is lost after rolling the Aegis Save once (if the bearer is hit by several simultaneous attacks, the owner chooses which attack to use the Aegis Save against).

specialrules.specialrule: Breath Attack  (Str 4 , AP 1, Flaming Attacks, Dying Embers)
